title: Crypto Firm SafeMoon Files for Chapter 7 Bankruptcy, SFM Plunges 42%
description: The firm's executives were arrested last month on multiple charges.

title: Brazil signs its overseas crypto tax bill into law
description:
Under the new taxes, Brazilian citizens will pay up to 15% of profits from crypto to the state.

The President of Brazil, Luis Inácio Lula da Silva, has signed a law introducing the taxation of crypto assets held abroad by the country's citizens. 

Lula signed the law on Dec. 12, which was then published the following day in the official Gazette of the Union. With some reservations, the law will come into force from Jan. 1, 2024.

The new taxes will not apply exclusively to crypto but also to profits and dividends gained by Brazilian taxpayers from investment funds, platforms, real estate or trusts abroad. The Brazilian government intends to collect around 20 billion reals ($4 billion) of new taxes next year.

Read more

title: U.S. financial regulators’ annual report warns of AI risks
description:
According to the report, specific AI tools are highly technical and complex, posing challenges for institutions to explain or monitor them effectively.

A panel of regulators warned on Dec 14 that the rapid adoption of artificial intelligence (AI) could create new risks for the United States' financial system if the technology is not adequately supervised.

The Financial Stability Oversight Council, comprised of top financial regulators and chaired by Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen, flagged the risks posed by AI for the first time in its annual financial stability report.

Though the team acknowledged AI’s potential to drive innovation and efficiency in financial institutions, they stressed the need for companies and regulators to remain vigilant due to the swift technological advancements.

Read more
